remixlab.proscene
Class InteractiveCameraFrame

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.proscene.Frame
      remixlab.proscene.InteractiveFrame
          remixlab.proscene.InteractiveDrivableFrame
              remixlab.proscene.InteractiveCameraFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, MouseGrabbable
public class InteractiveCameraFrame
extends InteractiveDrivableFrame

The InteractiveCameraFrame class represents an InteractiveFrame with Camera specific mouse bindings.

An InteractiveCameraFrame is a specialization of an InteractiveDrivableFrame (hence it can "fly" in the Scene), designed to be set as the Camera.frame(). Mouse motions are basically interpreted in a negated way: when the mouse goes to the right, the InteractiveFrame (and also the InteractiveDrivableFrame and the InteractiveAvatarFrame) translation goes to the right, while the InteractiveCameraFrame has to go to the left, so that the scene seems to move to the right.

An InteractiveCameraFrame rotates around its arcballReferencePoint() , which corresponds to the associated Camera.arcballReferencePoint().

Note: The InteractiveCameraFrame is not added to the Scene.mouseGrabberPool() upon creation.

Constructor Detail

InteractiveCameraFrame

public InteractiveCameraFrame(Camera cam)
Default constructor.

InteractiveDrivableFrame.flySpeed() is set to 0.0 and InteractiveDrivableFrame.flyUpVector() is (0,1,0). The arcballReferencePoint() is set to (0,0,0).

Attention: Created object is InteractiveFrame.removeFromMouseGrabberPool().

Calls InteractiveFrame.clone() and makes a deep copy of the remaining object attributes.

modified

protected void modified()
Updates the Camera.lastFrameUpdate variable when the frame changes and then calls super.modified().

Overrides:
modified in class Frame

spin

public void spin()
Overloading of InteractiveFrame.spin().

Rotates the InteractiveCameraFrame around its #arcballReferencePoint() instead of its origin.

Overrides:
spin in class InteractiveFrame

arcballReferencePoint

public PVector arcballReferencePoint()
Returns the point the InteractiveCameraFrame revolves around when rotated.

It is defined in the world coordinate system. Default value is (0,0,0).

When the InteractiveCameraFrame is associated to a Camera, Camera.arcballReferencePoint() also returns this value.

setArcballReferencePoint

public void setArcballReferencePoint(PVector refP)
Sets the arcballReferencePoint(), defined in the world coordinate system.

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(Point eventPoint,
                         Camera camera)
Overloading of InteractiveDrivableFrame.mouseDragged(Point, Camera) .

Motion depends on mouse binding. The resulting displacements are basically inverted from those of an InteractiveFrame.

Specified by:
mouseDragged in interface MouseGrabbable
Overrides:

mouseWheelMoved

public void mouseWheelMoved(int rotation,
                            Camera camera)
Overloading of InteractiveDrivableFrame.mouseWheelMoved(int, Camera) .

The wheel behavior depends on the wheel binded action. Current possible actions are Scene.MouseAction.ZOOM, Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD and Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD. Scene.MouseAction.ZOOM speed depends on #wheelSensitivity() the other two depend on #flySpeed().

Specified by:
mouseWheelMoved in interface MouseGrabbable
Overrides:
mouseWheelMoved in class InteractiveDrivableFrame
See Also:
InteractiveFrame.setWheelSensitivity(float)
